meanings.definition: The act of estimating or determining the worth or price of something.
meanings.sent1: Her valuations of the antique furniture were always accurate.
meanings.sent2: Real estate valuations can fluctuate based on market conditions.
meanings.sent3: During the valuations at the charity event, she accidentally priced a toy at $1000!
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, valuations can sometimes be as subjective as the colors on a canvas.
meanings.sent5: The valuations made by the expert appraiser were so detailed, they could almost bring the items to life.

meanings.definition: The assessed or estimated value of something.
meanings.sent1: The valuations of the company's assets were higher than expected.
meanings.sent2: Insurance companies often require valuations of expensive jewelry before providing coverage.
meanings.sent3: The valuations of the rare stamp collection left the collector feeling quite wealthy.
meanings.sent4: To him, her smile was beyond any valuations of material possessions.
meanings.sent5: The valuations of the old coins were so precise, they seemed almost magical in their accuracy.

meanings.definition: The process of determining the value of an asset or property.
meanings.sent1: The valuations conducted by the bank were thorough and meticulous.
meanings.sent2: Before selling the house, they needed to get valuations done by professionals.
meanings.sent3: The valuations of the rare painting turned into a fun guessing game among friends.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, valuations can sometimes feel like solving a complex puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The valuations of the land were so crucial for the development project that they were done multiple times to ensure accuracy.
